verse:
अविद्यायामन्तरे वर्तमानाः स्वयं धीराः पण्डितं मन्यमानाः।
जङ्घन्यमानाः परियन्ति मूढा अन्धेनैव नीयमाना यथान्धाः ॥

terms.परियन्ति: revolve or wander (in the cycle of birth and death),

meaning: Meaning: In this verse, the poet describes the plight of those who are living in the darkness of ignorance. Despite considering themselves as intelligent and learned, they continue to wander in the cycle of birth and death like fools. They are like blind people being led by someone else, unable to see the path of true knowledge and liberation.
